METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Phantom Borders in Croatia: The Case Study of the Primorje-Gorski Kotar County
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Fantomske meje na Hrvaškem: študija primera Primorsko-goranske županije
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Bagarić, Petar
METS:xmlData.dcterms:subject: fantomske meje
Hrvaška
primorsko-goranska županija
phantom borders
Croatia
Primorje-Gorski Kotar County
METS:xmlData.dcterms:publisher: Oddelek za zgodovino Filozofske fakultete Univerze v Ljubljani, Ljubljana

METS:xmlData.entity:description: Fantomske meje so tiste nekdanje meje, ki še vedno vplivajo na sodobni svet. Identificiramo jih lahko z volilno geografijo. Ta prispevek bo posvečen fantomskih mejam, ki jih lahko opazimo na ozemlju Primorsko-goranske županije z glavnim mestom Reko. Ker so po ozemlju te županije skozi zgodovino potekale številne meje, bodo v prispevku analizirane morebitne fantomske meje kot posledica političnih delitev v obdobju 1867–1947. Pri analizi rezultatov volitev in referendumov na ozemlju te županije v obdobju med letoma 2009 in 2015 z metodami volilne geografije se bodo tako upoštevali morebitni učinki meja Kraljevine Hrvaške in Slavonije, mesta Reka (Fiume) in avstrijske Istre ter rapalske meje med Kraljevino Italijo, Kraljevino Srbov, Hrvatov in Slovencev in Svobodno državo reko, pa tudi meje med Kraljevino Italijo in Neodvisno državo Hrvaško. Zadevne volitve in referendumi vključujejo hrvaške predsedniške volitve v letih 2009/10 in 2014/15, referendum o pristopu Hrvaške k EU leta 2012, referendum o definiciji zakonske zveze leta 2013, volitve v parlament EU leta 2013 in 2014 ter lokalne volitve leta 2013. Podatki bodo analizirani na ravni občin. Rezultati hrvaških parlamentarnih volitev bodo izključeni, ker je za namene parlamentarnih volitev županija razdeljena na dve volilni okrožji (sedmo in osmo), volivci v obeh okrožjih pa imajo običajno na izbiro različno število seznamov kandidatov.

The phantom borders are those former borders that continue to structure the modern world. Phantom borders are identifiable through the electoral geography. The topic of this work will be the phantom borders visible on the territory of the Primorje-Gorski Kotar County with the capital in Rijeka. Since the territory of that county has been crossed by many borders throughout its history, this work will analyse the eventual phantom borders, which would be the consequence of political divisions throughout the period 1867-1947. So, the potential effects of the borders of Croatia-Slavonia, City of Rijeka (Fiume) and Austrian Istria as well the Rapallo border line between Kingdom of Italy, Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes and Free State of Fiume as well as border between Kingdom of Italy and Independent State of Croatia would be taken into account in analysing the results of the elections and referenda conducted on the territory of the county in the period between 2009 and 2015 through the methods of electoral geography. The elections and referenda in question include, two Croatian presidential elections conducted in 2009/10 and 2014/15, referendum on Croatia's EU accession in 2012, referendum on the definition of marriage conducted in 2013, EU Parliament elections in 2013 and 2014 and local elections conducted in 2013. The data would be analysed on the level of municipalities. The results for Croatian parliamentary elections will be excluded, because for the parliamentary elections the county is divided into two electoral districts (Seventh and Eighth) with usually different numbers of candidate lists offered to the voters in each of them.
